thread.title: Dad takes 10-year-old on 'trip of a lifetime' cycling Europe
thread.title_full: Dad takes 10-year-old on 'trip of a lifetime' cycling Europe

title: Dad takes 10-year-old on 'trip of a lifetime' cycling Europe
text:
Dad takes 10-year-old on 'trip of a lifetime' cycling Europe Trinette Stevens | 5th Oct 2015 11:13 AM Trinette Stevens Stuart Wright and his 10-year-old son "Macca" on their month-long bike ride through Europe Photo: Contributed Related Items   
ROCKHAMPTON'S Stuart Wright has fulfilled a decades long promise to take all his children on life changing trips once they hit 10-years-old. 
The financial planner took his youngest son Mackenzie 'Macca' Wright on a month-long cycling trip across the entire length of Europe's Rhine River in July. 
The holiday follows a trip in 2012 which saw Stuart take his eldest son, Cooper Wright, to Mt Everest. 
Stuart said he wanted give them an experience they will never forget, while enjoying some quality bonding time. 
See the full story in tomorrow's The Morning Bulletin
